items.sentence: I can\'t find my ticket. I must\'ve lost it.
There was hardly any furniture in the house.
I can never remember how to spell your name.
Why are you making such a big deal about it?
You need to start saving for retirement now.
You need to try to understand how Tom feels.
Let\'s ask Tom when he thinks he\'ll arrive.
Tom would\'ve gone with you if he could\'ve.
I always eat breakfast cereal without sugar.
Tom said Boston was hotter than he expected.
Have both Tom and Mary forgotten to do that?
Have you been standing there the whole time?
Tom doesn\'t need to tell me how to do that.
Tom is concerned about his parents\' health.
Tom is smarter than most people think he is.
Tom is someone who might be able to help us.
You look like you could use a cup of coffee.
I was surprised that Tom refused to do that.
Tom was partly responsible for the accident.
Don\'t walk past me as if we were strangers.
Tom doesn\'t seem to be as happy as Mary is.
Please learn to spell your teachers\' names.

This building will be demolished next month.
I thought that I might find you two out here

Tom often has trouble choosing what to wear.
I\'ve got a lot of stories I could tell you.

The only time I wear glasses is when I read.
I think that I\'ve figured out how to do it.

We shouldn\'t have told Tom about the party.

From now on, I'm only going to speak French.

That's the ugliest baby that I've ever seen.
Individuality is very important in the West.
